newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks seen falling over strike threat.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks seen falling over strike threat.

text.p: Shares on the Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) may fall on an opposition strike threat when the market reopens on Wednesday after a bank holiday, brokers said.

"The investors are likely to remain cautious ahead of Thursday's strike called by (the) Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) to protest levying of taxes in the new budget," said Redwanul Islam of Dastagir Mohammad Adil & Company. Brokers said major players, including institutions, might watch the market while small investors were expected to trade selectively.
The DSE all-share price index lost 16.94 points or 1.50 percent to 1,111.55 at the close of Monday's trading.
